content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Holland Road, Singapore" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2018)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Subzone of Bukit Timah Planning Area in Singapore **Holland Road** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 荷兰路) is a subzone of the [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah) [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) named after the major road of the same name in [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Holland Road is located between the borders of Clementi, [Holland Village](/wiki/Holland_Village,_Singapore), a neighborhood along the [Queenstown](/wiki/Queenstown,_Singapore)–Bukit Timah boundary which is popular for its restaurants, cafes and nightspots and is frequented by [expatriates](/wiki/Expatriate), and Dempsey Hill. ## Etymology Holland Road and Holland Village were named after an early resident in Singapore, Hugh Holland, who was an [architect](/wiki/Architect). The roads Holland Avenue, Holland Close and [Holland Drive](/wiki/Holland_Drive) were named as such in 1972. Holland Road is known as *hue hng au* in [Hokkien](/wiki/Min_Nan), meaning "behind the flower garden". The "flower garden" refers to the [Botanic Gardens](/wiki/Singapore_Botanic_Gardens). This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Holland Road, Singapore
